item.title: Aurora’s driverless trucks can now travel farther distances faster than human drivers
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: CEO Chris Urmson called it a “superhuman” moment, adding that Aurora’s trucks can now carry freight 1,000 miles in 15 hours — faster than what a human driver can legally accomplish.

item.title: More US investors sue South Korean government over handling of Coupang data breach
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Coupang’s massive data breach has sparked U.S. investor lawsuits against the South Korean government over alleged discrimination.

item.title: Apple acquires all rights to ‘Severance,’ will produce future seasons in-house
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The show is expected to run for four seasons, with the possibility of spin-offs, a prequel, and foreign versions.

item.title: US FTC airs concerns over allegations that Apple News suppresses right-wing content
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: In a letter to Apple CEO Tim Cook, FTC chair Andrew Ferguson cited reports from Media Research Center, a right-leaning think tank, which accused Apple of excluding right-leaning outlets from the top 20 articles in the Apple News feed.

item.title: Eclipse backs all-EV marketplace Ever in $31M funding round
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The San Francisco-based startup says its AI-first approach has allowed it to scale faster.

item.title: xAI lays out interplanetary ambitions in public all-hands
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: On Wednesday, xAI took the rare step of publishing its full 45-minute all-hands presentation to the X platform, making it widely available.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.

item.title: OpenAI disbands mission alignment team
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The team's leader has been given a new role as OpenAI's chief futurist, while the other team members have been reassigned throughout the company.

item.title: Apple’s Siri revamp reportedly delayed… again
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: While the new Siri was expected to launch with the upcoming iOS 26.4 update in March, now, the changes are expected to roll out more slowly over time, reportedly postponing some features until the May iOS update, or even until the release of iOS 27 in September.

item.title: Uber Eats launches AI assistant to help with grocery cart creation
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Uber Eats launched a new AI feature, “Cart Assistant,” that can automatically add items to your cart based on text or image prompts.

item.title: Who will own your company’s AI layer? Glean’s CEO explains
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit underneath other AI […]

item.title: Elon Musk suggests spate of xAI exits have been push, not pull
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: At least nine engineers, including two co-founders, have announced their exits from xAI in the past week, fueling online speculation and raising questions about stability at Musk’s AI company amid mounting controversy.

item.title: Microsoft says hackers are exploiting critical zero-day bugs to target Windows and Office users
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Critical security flaws targeting Windows and Office users allow hackers to take complete control of a victim's computer by clicking a malicious link or opening a file. Patch now.

item.title: How to get into a16z’s super-competitive Speedrun startup accelerator program
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: TechCrunch spoke to a16z partner Joshua Lu for some tips on standing out for the Speedrun program.

item.title: Cash App adds payment links so you can get paid in a DM
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The new feature allows users to share payment requests in a variety of digital settings.

item.title: Amazon’s new eero Signal keeps you connected to the internet when outages occur
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: A new device from eero will keep you online even if your ISP goes down.

item.title: The search is on: 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award nominations are open
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Nominations for the 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award are open, inviting SMBs with groundbreaking innovation a chance to win scaling opportunities. Last day to apply is February 13.

item.title: Activist investor Ancora publicly opposes the WBD-Netflix deal
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: An investment group is trying to sway Netflix shareholders to reject the WBD deal in favor of Paramount.

item.title: DOJ says Trenchant boss sold exploits to Russian broker capable of accessing ‘millions of computers and devices’
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The former boss of the L3Harris-owned hacking and surveillance tools maker Trenchant faces nine years in prison for selling several exploits to a Russian broker, which counts the Russian government among its customers.

item.title: Why the economics of orbital AI are so brutal
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: A 1 GW orbital data center would cost roughly $42.4 billion — almost three times its ground-bound equivalent.
